data.text:
Richard Jefferson, a former professional basketball player in the NBA, has transitioned into a role as a commentator for ESPN. During his college years, he played for the Arizona Wildcats and went on to be selected in the first round of the NBA Draft in 2001. Additionally, he proudly represented the United States at the 2004 Olympic Games, contributing to the team’s achievement of a bronze medal.

Richard Jefferson Biography & Profile Summary

Born on June 21, 1980, in Los Angeles, California, Richard Allen Jefferson Jr., commonly referred to as Richard Jefferson. Raised in Phoenix, Arizona, he was the son of Richard Jefferson Sr. and Meekness LeCato, both Christian missionaries. Jefferson received his education in Phoenix and displayed his passion for basketball from a young age.

Born to Richard Allen Jefferson Senior (father) and Meekness LeCato (mother), he grew up as the only child in a loving family. Growing up, his parents instilled in him a deep-rooted faith and actively involved him in a Christian religious organization. Due to their strong devotion, his family frequently relocated, adapting to new surroundings as they followed their religious path.

Richard Jefferson Age and Birthdate

Richard Jefferson was born on June 21, 1980, making him 43 years old as of 2023. Born and raised in Los Angeles, California, he has made a significant impact on the basketball world with his talent and dedication.

Richard Jefferson Height and Weight

Standing at 6 feet 5 inches (201 cm), Richard Jefferson possesses an impressive height that has served him well in his basketball career. In terms of weight, he weighs approximately 233 pounds (106 kilograms), showcasing his athletic build and strength.

Richard Jefferson Education

Jefferson attended Moon Valley High School, where he made a significant impact as a member of the basketball team. In 1998, the team won the 4A State Championship, showcasing Jefferson’s talent and dedication. Following high school, he received a basketball scholarship to Arizona University, where he continued to excel both academically and athletically.

Richard Jefferson Professional Career

In 2001, Jefferson turned professional and began his career with the New Jersey Nets. Initially coming off the bench, he gradually earned a spot as a starting small forward. His exceptional performances led to an extension of his contract in 2004, worth $78 million. Although he intended to remain with the Nets, he was later traded to the Milwaukee Bucks in 2008 and subsequently joined the San Antonio Spurs in 2009.

Over the years, Jefferson played for several teams, including the Golden State Warriors, Utah Jazz, Dallas Mavericks, Cleveland Cavaliers, and Denver Nuggets. His contributions to the teams he played for were invaluable, and he made notable achievements, including an NBA Championship in 2016 while playing for the Cleveland Cavaliers.

Richard Jefferson Current Ventures

Since retiring from professional basketball, he has transitioned into a career as a basketball analyst and commentator. He currently works for ESPN and Pac-12 Networks, where he shares his expertise and insights on the sport. Jefferson’s wealth of knowledge and experience in the game make him a respected figure in the world of basketball analysis.

Richard Jefferson Net Worth and Earnings

As of 2021, Richard Jefferson’s net worth is estimated to be $60 million. The majority of his wealth comes from his successful basketball career, which spanned from 2001 to 2018. Throughout his career, he earned substantial salaries from his contracts with various teams. Additionally, his endorsement deals and appearances further contributed to his earnings.

Richard Jefferson Wife

Richard Jefferson is a married man and a proud father. Model Teresa Lourenco is his wife, and they have a son together. Although the exact date of their wedding is unknown, they have been seen together, emanating joy. Teresa has two children from a previous marriage, and the blended family enjoys their time together.

Prior to his marriage, Richard had several romantic relationships. Notably, he was in a relationship with Jennie Finch, a professional softball player whom he met during their university years. Richard had previously planned to marry Kesha Nichols, but he called off the wedding at the last moment.
